author: mariohavel
content:
<@&857649635274915900> Second week of the fellowship is here! Please read the message carefully so you don't miss on anything important. 

This week is dedicated to further researching and narrowing down your areas of interest. There is a lot of topics to explore, many projects still don't have anyone looking into to them ðŸ‘€
If you need any advice or guidance in this phase, don't hesitate to reach out!  Looking forward to see more updates on your progress, please use the thread to share them during this week: https://discord.com/channels/595666850260713488/1386650350219431988/1386650355168841858

author: mariohavel
content:
We will meet exactly in one week in Cannes! EPF Day is in one week and everyone is invited to join us there. If you are planning to come and haven't seen the discord thread, DM us. Make sure to to prepare everything for the trip and a couple of slides to present your project focus. By the end of this week you should have some idea what you plan to work on since there will be an opportunity to discuss it with everyone, including mentors, in person. Each fellow will have a short (5-10 min) presentation about their project idea(s), only sort of a draft to get feedback before finishing the full project proposal. Everyone who cannot make it to Cannes will present online afterwards at Office Hours. 

Today at <t:1750690800:t> (3PM UTC), we will have our first stand up call. It's an opportunity to meet other fellows and present your current research. Everyone will give a brief (1min) update on their current progress so we all can learn about each others work, ask questions or provide feedback right away. There will be also some more info on the upcoming Office Hours and EthCC from us. See you there!

author: mariohavel
content: <@&857649635274915900> Our first regular standup is starting in <t:1750690800:R>! Join us at https://meet.ethereum.org/epf-standup

author: harsh.ps.2003
content:
I was not able to give update due to connection issues (tired 3 clients and rejoined more than 10 times for sure). So I am giving it here!

In previous week I worked on draft proposal of Fast Confirmation Rule in Lighthouse primarily. Went through Prysm's experimental implementation, found out that they are facing issues with that. Tried going through Lighthouse codebase, saw some different architecture, and wrote in my proposal how I think the FCR can be implemented in Lighthouse experimentally with proper benchmarking. Apart from this, I already have draft proposals on 3 other projects. For FCR, I dont know whether Lighthouse wants it right now or not, so maybe <@686695036733227017> can help here. The week 1 update is - https://hackmd.io/@harsh-ps-2003/B1QE4NVVxg

If lighthouse wants it, there are some challenges that come with implementing FCR that Prysm faced, and so, Lighthouse coredevs must have some thoughts about that. I have written my approach in draft proposal, would love it if <@686695036733227017> can take a look to point out some mistake if any. 

If lighthouse is not interested, I can pick anyone of 3 projects that I have drafted. 
This week 2 I want to finalize what project I want to work on, and make EthCC presentation around it. I want to dive deeper into the selected project this week. 

If lighthouse wants FCR in an experimental state like Prysm, I would love to work on it.

Also, Ephemery Tests are not desired by geth team! And previously implementation in Lighthouse was unsuccessful.  So it would be great to know which team wants it!

Grandine: zkVMs for Beacon Chain Snarkification project  is interesting, but I am unable to find out where risc0 and sp1 testing has happened! 

Erigon: RISCV Executable Proof Sourcing seems quite intense. Even though I have written a detailed draft proposal on this, I am not sure this can be wrapped up in EPF. Huge scope.

Week 0 update as other 3 drafts - https://hackmd.io/@harsh-ps-2003/rk4ZFSwXxx
